articles.title: AI Boom, Entry-Level Bust: Why College Grads Are Struggling to Land Jobs
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence transforms the job market, recent college graduates are finding it harder to land entry-level roles in competitive fields like tech and finance â€” even with strong rÃ©sumÃ©s and top internships. Economists point to a surge in AI adoption, along with a slowdown in post-pandemic hiring, as key factors driving unemployment among college grads above the national average. Financial leaders like Centerview Partnersâ€™ Blair Effron warn that although the AI revolution will boost long-term productivity, short-term impacts on employment will be swift and dramatic. (Source: Bloomberg)
